raw_comment: The graph shows if the ages between 15-24 and 40+ have optimism about future generations. I notice that the 15-24 year olds have hope for future generations in many countries. While the 40+ year olds only have hope for future generations in Morocco, India, and Nigeria. I wonder why there is such a difference and what the leading opinions for the 15-24 year olds are vs the 40+ year olds. This relates to my community because I am in the category of 15-24 year olds. I do have optimism for the future generations but I hope that the world gets it together so these next generations can thrive.  I would title this graph: "  Optimism For Future Generations Around the World "
ace_sentences: The graph shows optimism about future generations for people between 15 and 24 years old.
The graph shows optimism about future generations for people who are 40 years old or older.
I notice that many countries have 15-24 year olds who have hope for future generations.
I notice that only Morocco has 40+ year olds who have hope for future generations.
I notice that only India has 40+ year olds who have hope for future generations.
I notice that only Nigeria has 40+ year olds who have hope for future generations.
There is a difference between the two age groups.
I wonder why this difference exists.
I wonder what the leading opinions of the 15-24 year olds are.
I wonder what the leading opinions of the 40+ year olds are.
I am between 15 and 24 years old.
I have optimism for future generations.
I hope that the world gets it together.
I hope that the next generations can thrive.
The title of this graph is "Optimism For Future Generations Around the World".
